gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: CESM Caseroot files archive including XML, user namelists and case source modifications.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Atmosphere time slice with present day SST and pre-industrial Arctic SIC

gmd:individualName.gco:CharacterString: Community Earth System Model developers and affiliates

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: UCAR/NCAR - Climate and Global Dynamics Laboratory
UCAR/NCAR - Climate and Global Dynamics Laboratory

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString:
Atmosphere-only time slice experiment forced by climatological monthly mean sea surface temperature (SST) for the present day sea and pre-industrial Actic sea ice concentration (SIC). Radiative forcing to be set to present day (year 2000) levels. Past SIC will be computed from the ensemble of CMIP5 simulations by PAMIP. Sea ice thickness should be specified according to the CMIP6 AMIP protocol. Time slice simulations to begin on 1st April and run for 14 months, the first two months are ignored to allow for an initial model spin up. Minimum ensemble size is 100 simulations. (CMIP6 Experiment).
Users can access the data from the Earth System Grid Federation or Climate Data Gateway as registered users; see the 'Related links' section.
Diagnostic plots are also available from the 'Related links'.
NCAR users may access the data from Glade; path(s) listed in the 'Additional Information' section.
This is the only DASH metadata record for members 001 through 100 of a 100 member ensemble set.

gmd:credit.gco:CharacterString: The CESM project is supported primarily by the National Science Foundation (NSF). This material is based upon work supported by the National Center for Atmospheric Research, which is a major facility sponsored by the NSF under Cooperative Agreement No. 1852977. Computing and data storage resources, including the Cheyenne supercomputer (doi:10.5065/D6RX99HX), were provided by the Computational and Information Systems Laboratory (CISL) at NCAR.

These data were generated by release-cesm2.1.0 on 2019-02-26 using machine cheyenne.

case_id = 365
compset = HIST_CAM60_CLM50%BGC-CROP_CICE%PRES_DOCN%DOM_MOSART_CISM2%NOEVOLVE_SWAV
grid = a%0.9x1.25_l%0.9x1.25_oi%0.9x1.25_r%r05_g%gland4_w%null_m%gx1v7
